title: Leading the World in Supersonic Flight
summary:
The document outlines Executive Order 14304, issued on June 6, 2025, which aims to reestablish the United States as a leader in supersonic flight. It identifies outdated regulations as barriers to innovation and competitiveness in aerospace. The order mandates the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to repeal the prohibition on overland supersonic flight and to develop new noise certification standards, thus facilitating the advancement of supersonic aviation technology.

Key actions include:
- Immediate repeal of specific regulations hindering supersonic flight.
- Issuance of a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking within 18 months to establish noise certification standards based on research and community feedback.
- Coordination of research and development efforts across various government agencies to support the integration of supersonic aircraft into the National Airspace System.
- Promotion of international collaboration to align supersonic regulations globally.

The implications of this order are significant, as it aims to enhance the safety, efficiency, and competitiveness of American aviation, while also addressing environmental concerns regarding noise. The initiative seeks to foster innovation and regain leadership in high-speed aviation, potentially transforming air travel in the coming years.
